commentary: Nortje to MDKJ Perera, OUT strikes first ball! And the Durban hero falls! Kusal Perera, the man who defied South Africa in the most epic manner not too long ago, is taken out by a ball measured at 145 kph on the speedgun. And yet it seems as if his undoing is because he is too early into the shot. The ball - back of a length on leg stump - seems to stick in the pitch and the left-hander, looking to flick it over midwicket, only ends up top-edging towards point where Miller runs in, dives forward and takes a splendid catch

commentary: Imran Tahir to BOP Fernando, OUT confusion, run-out chance, direct hit! Great work from Nortje at short third man! Mendis is the man running to the danger end but Oshada is never convinced. Worse. He's taken a couple of steps down the track and then just stops. That means Mends has run halfway down the pitch. Then he stops. Seeing Mendis has run halfway down the pitch Oshada accepts the single but by that time the damage is done. Nortje picks the ball up, throws the stumps at the strikers end down and Sri Lanka lose a big one. Mendis actually threw his bat away in pure frustration at that horrible turn of events (Oh and before I forget, the ball was shortish and outside off, Oshada played a deft little dab)

commentary: Imran Tahir to Rajitha, OUT traps him lbw! Tahir's sprinted all the way to point. Didn't even bother to look at the umpire. His finger's up though. And this is special. This is Tahir's trademark. The quicker delivery. The googly. Pitching on off stump. Cutting back into the batsman - a batsman who thinks this will be a leg break and so he can go back and cut. 'Well, boo!' says the ball as it cuts in and strikes low on the back pad in front of the sticks
